oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1940-03-23 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 23, 1940. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Ford Rush with Ford Rush Jr., the Crook Brothers, the Stacey Sisters, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Ford Rush; Crook Brothers; Stacey Sisters
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (David Stone) -- Opening theme -- David Stone introduces George D. Hay -- George D. Hay introduces Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys -- New Greenback Dollar (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- George D. Hay introduces Ford Rush -- When The Red, Red Robin Comes Bob, Bob, Bobbin' Along (Ford Rush) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone) -- George D. Hay introduces the Crook Brothers -- New River Train (Crook Brothers) -- George D. Hay introduces the Stacey Sisters -- When It's Springtime In The Rockies (Stacey Sisters) -- George D. Hay talks -- Little Liza Jane (cast) -- Prince Albert commercial (David Stone)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Stone, David P., 1901-1995; Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rush, Ford, 1895-; Crook, Herman; Crook Brothers; Stacey Sisters (Musical group); McGar, Mac; Rush, Ford Jr.
